column2:
ADJECTIVE

predicative
Lacking care or attention to duty; negligent.
‘it would be very ___ of me not to pass on that information’

NOUN

1archaic A pirate.  
1.1A pirate ship.  
1.2A privateer, especially one operating along the southern shore of the Mediterranean in the 16th?18th centuries.

ADJECTIVE

Relating to or denoting the present epoch, which is the second epoch in the Quaternary period and followed the Pleistocene. 完新世
‘subfossil material of the family has been recovered from ___ deposits on Madagascar’
Also called "Recent"  
The ___ epoch has lasted from about 10,000 years ago to the present day. It covers the period since the ice retreated after the last glaciation and it is sometimes regarded as just another interglacial period

VERB

[WITH OBJECT]
1Strip the skin off (a corpse or carcass)
‘the captured general was __d alive’  
1.1Strip (the skin) off a corpse or carcass.
‘she __d the white skin from the flesh’

ADJECTIVE

1Having a pleasant and distinctive smell.
‘a massage with ___ oils’  
2Chemistry 
Relating to or denoting organic compounds containing a planar unsaturated ring of atoms which is stabilized by an interaction of the bonds forming the ring, e.g. benzene and its derivatives.

NOUN

mass noun
Infection of the intestines resulting in severe diarrhoea with the presence of blood and mucus in the faeces. 赤痢
Amoebic ___ is caused by the protozoan Entamoeba histolytica, mainly in warm climates, and spread by contaminated water and food; bacterial ___ is caused by bacteria of the genus Shigella and can also spread by contact (see and shigella and )
